The categories themselves are not mutually exclusive,
and some studies belong in more than one category* Only two
were so listed, although many others might have been if more
definitive information had been provided. (See Appendix C
for a list of studies arranged categorically.)
Publications
Replies in the Publications section of the questionnaire
indicated that much of the completed research activity has
been reported in published books, monographs and articles.
This is another encouraging sign, in that to a very great
extent the research results do become available in readily
accessible print form. There were 542 entries in this section,
more than 60% of these publications (340) were accounted for
by just eleven individuals. A complete list of publications
is not included in this report, since it was felt that adequate
references and indexes exist which already cite this material.
Unpublished or Duplicated Materials
As encouraging as the total is for published materials,
a considerable number of unpublished or duplicated materials
were reported. Almost a third as many reports were cited in
this category as were listed in the publications section.
